column4: is there anything that can be used to increase system performance?
is there anything that can make me run faster?
see above
again, doesn't tell me much, but I'll take a guess that you might be swapping a bit aggressively
try sudo sysctl vm.swappiness=0
see why I asked?  :)
uhm, i just did 'sudo sysctl vm.swappiness=0', what did i just do?
it tells the kernel to not swap out processes until absolutely neccessary;  if apps are hanging for a few seconds at a time, it's generally a good approach
but i still don't know if that's your problem :)
hmm
open a terminal window
flying by
zoom
okay, doesn't sound like the vid card
can you describe what you mean by slow?

well its kinda the drawing. as i drag a window around the screen, it lags behind. and you can kinda see the window being drawn from top to bottom with each refresh of movement. (about 3 times a second)
do you know what i mean? its like its struggling to draw the window on the screen.
how do the screensaver's look?  (esp the 3d ones)
like hell. as i said everything opengl runs at a frame every couple of seconds.
hmmm. maybe it better run like anything when i get my geforce 6200. but right now im trying to do some word processing and scrolling the page goes really badly. :(
what type of mb?
gigabyte sis 661fx chipset with DDR400
